content.question: The mass of a colony of bacteria, in grams, is modeled by the function <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> given by <math alttext="P of t equals, 2 plus, 5 times the inverse tangent of the fraction t over 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>P</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn><msup><mrow><mi>tan</mi></mrow><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mrow></msup><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is measured in days. What is the instantaneous rate of change of the mass of the colony, in grams per day, at the moment the colony reaches a mass of 6 grams?

topic.text: 4.1: Interpreting the Meaning of the Derivative in Context

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
